comments:
Starting with the last dev-build (0.6.0.20060717-1630), it started to log some strange messages in the error log every time a bugzilla query is synchronized.

org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.core.UnrecognizedReponseException:
<here goes my bugzilla login html page>
       at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.core.BugzillaServerFacade.parseHtmlError(BugzillaServerFacade.java:200)

       at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.core.AbstractReportFactory.collectResults(AbstractReportFactory.java:138)

       at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.ui.search.RepositoryQueryResultsFactory.performQuery(RepositoryQueryResultsFactory.java:41)

       at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.ui.tasklist.BugzillaRepositoryConnector.queryForChanged(BugzillaRepositoryConnector.java:445)

       at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.ui.tasklist.BugzillaRepositoryConnector.getChangedSinceLastSync(BugzillaRepositoryConnector.java:432)

       at org.eclipse.mylar.tasks.ui.AbstractRepositoryConnector.synchronizeChanged(AbstractRepositoryConnector.java:486)

       at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.tasks.ui.ScheduledTaskListSynchJob$1.done(ScheduledTaskListSynchJob.java:98)

       at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.JobListeners$3.notify(JobListeners.java:39)

       at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.JobListeners.doNotify(JobListeners.java:112)

       at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.JobListeners.done(JobListeners.java:152)

       at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.JobManager.endJob(JobManager.java:540)

       at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.WorkerPool.endJob(WorkerPool.java:100)

       at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:74)

I was able to produce very similar results by setting requirelogin=true on a test repository.  I've committed changes necessary to allow this to work but would like confirmation if this resolves your particular issue.  The fix will be in the next dev build (which will probably be up sooner than Friday considering the change set issues).

Yes, my bugzilla installation is configured with the "require login" parameter == true, so this may be the case.

I'll wait for the next dev-build to give you any feedback.

Thanks.

I confirm the fix.

I tested with dev-build 0.6.0.v20060717-2300, and the message does not appear anymore.
Great! Thanks for the confirmation Willian. Marking fixed.

traces.message: <here goes my bugzilla login html page>
